Articles.Content:
Greetings to all mission controllers, commanders, pilots, engineers and Kerbal Space Center staff,

my name is Doctor Mandarb, and haveing signed in with the forum back in summer 2014, I'll now be active on here too... yeah time goes by fast, doesn't it?

I've been playing KSP for almost 1.000 h's now, and 95% of all that gameplay time has been live-streamed (over the last 2 years). With KSP 1.1 on the horizon, I feel it's the perfect time to come back and turn my stream into a family friendly place. You are all more then welcome to jump in whenever you like. And if not, I'll still hope you'll enjoy KSP as much as I will!

In the past I loved useing a lot of mods that made KSP harder and more realistic. But since I'm expecting 1.1 to break all / most existing mods, I'll stay away from any and will play KSP 1.0.5 in it's natural state. Best wishes and hopes of success to the team working on KSP 1.1. I hope you'll be able to deliver a solid version in 2016!

To make a long story short, it's good to be back with the Kerbals! I hope to add at least another 500 hours of gameplay during 2016!

Take care and fly save.

Doctor Mandarb!

Hello Doctor Mandarb, and welcome to the forum!

Yes, time does go by quickly.  Especially when you're playing KSP.

Happy landings!

Hi, @Doctor Mandarb!

Well, you've been playing KSP for about as long as I have, so I can't offer much advice. But fly safe!
